availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard F. Vinson (Lawrence County, Kentucky, farmer and county court clerk)

body.p: Lawrence County, Kentucky, farmer and court clerk. Kentucky native. Son of William Vinson and Jane Vinson. Married to Georgeanne Randall Vinson. Father of Victoria Vinson and Jane L. Vinson. Student in Wayne County, Virginia, in 1850. Farmer in Lawrence County, Kentucky, in 1860. Clerk of Lawrence County Court in Lawrence County from 1862 to 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Wayne County, District 66, p. 266B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, p. 620.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Louisa, p. 282B.
Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1863, Legislative Document Series, No. 10 (Frankfort, Ky.: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1864), 302.
Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1865, Legislative Document Series, No. 1 (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1866), 12.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #8830.
"Richard Fletcher Vinson (1838-1910)," Find A Grave, Memorial #133184825, accessed August 13, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/133184825.
